image.altText: A close shot of Mundine's face, microphones just visible in the foreground.

items.synopsis: Prominent No campaigner Warren Mundine says a lot of Australians wanted to vote Yes, but the campaign failed them in two main areas.Â Follow what happens next with our live blog.

title.children: Mundine says there are two key reasons why the Yes campaign lost

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The New South Wales Aboriginal Land Council has put out a statement from Indigenous Australians who supported the Voice referendum. In the statement "a week of silence" is announced, to grieve the outcome of the referendum and reflect on its meaning and significance. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags will be lowered to half-mast. "To our people we say: do not shed tears. This rejection was never for others to issue. The truth is that rejection was always ours to determine. The truth is that we offered this recognition and it has been refused. We now know where we stand in this our country. Always was. Always will be," the statement reads.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 'A week of silence for the Voice': NSW Aboriginal Land Council releases a statement

children.content: The New South Wales Aboriginal Land Council has put out a statement from Indigenous Australians who supported the Voice referendum.
In the statement "a week of silence" is announced, to grieve the outcome of the referendum and reflect on its meaning and significance.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags will be lowered to half-mast.

"To our people we say: do not shed tears. This rejection was never for others to issue. The truth is that rejection was always ours to determine. The truth is that we offered this recognition and it has been refused. We now know where we stand in this our country. Always was. Always will be," the statement reads.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The AEC is continuing to count postal votes, along with votes cast interstate and overseas. The AEC has tweeted: "The counting process involves a secondary count of all votes (a mandatory validation count) that is standard for all electoral events. "
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australian Electoral Commission continues counting votes

children.content: The AEC is continuing to count postal votes, along with votes cast interstate and overseas.
The AEC has tweeted:
"The counting process involves a secondary count of all votes (a mandatory validation count) that is standard for all electoral events. "

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: 13YARN national program manager Majorie Anderson says the Indigenous hotline was fielding an increase in calls from people "disappointed" about the referendum result. Support for Indigenous Australians Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander crisis support line 13YARN on 13 92 76 eSafety Commission's First Nations resources "We're getting a lot of calls on the referendum at the moment," she told ABC Radio. "We did have to bring in some extra people. "And largely, the calls were about being disappointed about the outcome of the referendum." Listen to the full interview below:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Indigenous hotline fields increase in calls from 'disappointed' people

items.synopsis: The foreign ministerÂ says multiple repatriation flights for Australians stuck in Israel and the West Bank may be able take off from Tel Aviv today, as IsraelÂ prepares to go into Gaza. Follow live.

title.children: Repatriation flights from Israel 'may be able to take off' today, Penny Wong says

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says multiple repatriation flights for Australians stuck in Israel and the West Bank may be able to take-off from Tel Aviv today. She wrote on social media the situation in the area continues to change rapidly, and the flights are subject to the deteriorating security environment in the region. Yesterday, the Department of Foreign Affairs cancelled scheduled flights due to depart this weekend due to security concerns.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Government planning multiple repatriation flights from Tel Aviv today

children.content: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says multiple repatriation flights for Australians stuck in Israel and the West Bank may be able to take-off from Tel Aviv today.
She wrote on social media the situation in the area continues to change rapidly, and the flights are subject to the deteriorating security environment in the region.
Yesterday, the Department of Foreign Affairs cancelled scheduled flights due to depart this weekend due to security concerns.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Pentagon has ordered a second aircraft carrier strike group to the eastern Mediterranean, near Israel. The USS Dwight D Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group (CSG) will depart from Norfolk in Virginia and includes a  guided-missile cruiser, three guided-missile destroyers, nine aircraft squadrons, and personnel. Secretary of Defense Lloyd J Austin said the shipment of more warships and aircraft was an effort to deter "hostile actions against Israel". The primary mission appears to be preventing Hezbollah, Iran or others from taking advantage of the situation in Israel and Gaza. "The increases to US force Posture signal the United States' ironclad commitment to Israelâs security and our resolve to deter any state or non-state actor seeking to escalate this war," Austin said in a statement. He is expected to arrive in Israel on Friday and meet with leaders to discuss what else the US can provide to the country.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Pentagon says US is sending a second aircraft carrier to the region

children.content: The Pentagon has ordered a second aircraft carrier strike group to the eastern Mediterranean, near Israel.

The USS Dwight D Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group (CSG) will depart from Norfolk in Virginia and includes a  guided-missile cruiser, three guided-missile destroyers, nine aircraft squadrons, and personnel.
Secretary of Defense Lloyd J Austin said the shipment of more warships and aircraft was an effort to deter "hostile actions against Israel".
The primary mission appears to be preventing Hezbollah, Iran or others from taking advantage of the situation in Israel and Gaza.

"The increases to US force Posture signal the United States' ironclad commitment to Israelâs security and our resolve to deter any state or non-state actor seeking to escalate this war," Austin said in a statement.
He is expected to arrive in Israel on Friday and meet with leaders to discuss what else the US can provide to the country.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Syrian defence ministry says Israel has launched an air strike against the international airport in Aleppo, which has put it out of service. This is the statement it gave to Reuters: "The Israeli enemy carried out an air attack from the direction of the Mediterranean Sea, west of Latakia, targeting Aleppo International Airport, which led to material damage to the airport and it being out of service," the ministry said. This is not the first time the airport has been hit. Two days ago, Syria's state media reported Israeli forces had launched "simultaneous" missile strikes on two main airports in Aleppo and Damascus. The attack damaged both runways and put both hubs out of service. The strikes on the airports are intended to disrupt Iranian supply lines to Syria, a source told Reuters. The Israeli military has not commented on the strikes, but earlier said that two rockets had been launched from Syria toward Israeli territory that "fell in an open area". "No interceptors were activated according to protocol," the IDF said of that incident.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Syria says Israeli airstrikes have hit Aleppo international airport again

children.content: The Syrian defence ministry says Israel has launched an air strike against the international airport in Aleppo, which has put it out of service.
This is the statement it gave to Reuters:

"The Israeli enemy carried out an air attack from the direction of the Mediterranean Sea, west of Latakia, targeting Aleppo International Airport, which led to material damage to the airport and it being out of service," the ministry said.
This is not the first time the airport has been hit. Two days ago, Syria's state media reported Israeli forces had launched "simultaneous" missile strikes on two main airports in Aleppo and Damascus.
The attack damaged both runways and put both hubs out of service.
The strikes on the airports are intended to disrupt Iranian supply lines to Syria, a source told Reuters.
The Israeli military has not commented on the strikes, but earlier said that two rockets had been launched from Syria toward Israeli territory that "fell in an open area".
"No interceptors were activated according to protocol," the IDF said of that incident.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Plenty of respect between these two fighters yesterday at the weigh in, which is what we want to see really. Nathaniel May (22-3) will take on Jackson England (14-2) for the vacant IBF Australasian super featherweight title. Both men made the weight, coming in at a very similar and sevelt 58.86kg and 58.82kg respectively. It should be a really fun contest over ten rounds so lets get it on.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Nathaniel May vs Jackson England

children.content: Plenty of respect between these two fighters yesterday at the weigh in, which is what we want to see really.
Nathaniel May
(22-3) will take on
Jackson England
(14-2) for the vacant IBF Australasian super featherweight title.
Both men made the weight, coming in at a very similar and sevelt 58.86kg and 58.82kg respectively.
It should be a really fun contest over ten rounds so lets get it on.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The judges have it 77-75, 77-75 and 77-75 all in favour of Shanell Dargan! I had this 78-74 in favour of Dargan too, and the judges agree. She hugs her son and looks incredibly emotional. "This means everything to me ... this is the start of a new journey and I want to go all the way to the top," she says in the ring. "All credit to [Amelia] ... that was a war." It really was. A terrific contest that was worthy of a belt being awarded. Dargan is in tears ringside now as she hugs her supporters - it's lovely to see. What a journey she has had as well.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Shanell Dargan is the new Australian super bantamweight champion!

children.content: (No Limit Boxing: Zain Mohammed)
The judges have it 77-75, 77-75 and 77-75 all in favour of Shanell Dargan!
I had this 78-74 in favour of Dargan too, and the judges agree.
She hugs her son and looks incredibly emotional.
"This means everything to me ... this is the start of a new journey and I want to go all the way to the top," she says in the ring.
"All credit to [Amelia] ... that was a war."
It really was. A terrific contest that was worthy of a belt being awarded.
(No Limit Boxing: Zain Mohammed)
Dargan is in tears ringside now as she hugs her supporters - it's lovely to see. What a journey she has had as well.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Time for the women now, eight, two-minute rounds at super bantamweight for the vacant Australian title. Shanell Dargan (2-1-2), a Wiradjuri and Mununjali woman, may be familiar to some people more in tune with their pop culture references than I am. Dargan performed on X-Factor in 2014, telling SBS that she sung in front of John Legend in New York. Her opponent is Amber Amelia (3-1), a Palawa woman who hails from Lake Macquarie. This is the first time an Australian title will be contested between two Indigenous women, for a belt that now features the Indigenous flag on it. Both women came in under the weight limit yesterday (54.94kg and 54.74kg respectively) and, again, were fully respectful of each other during the face off which, frankly, was lovely to see.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Shanell Dargan vs Amber Amelia
